description:
`furo-data-context-menu`
 A  [material design](https://material.io/components/menus/) context menu or menu element.

 You have to put a `furo-data-context-menu-display` element in one of the parent elements of the element where you use the `furo-data-context-menu`.
 The app-shell is a good place for that.

```html
 <furo-data-context-menu condensed position="below" ƒ-trigger="--menuClkd" ƒ-bind-data="--menuObject" @-menu-item-selected="--menuItem">
     <furo-icon-button icon="menu" @-click="--menuClkd"></furo-icon-button>
 </furo-data-context-menu>
```
name: FuroDataContextMenu

slots.description: default slot to add an individual context menu opener component (e.g. furo-icon-button).

members.name: bindData
members.description: Bind your menu object with the signature of menu.Menuitem or [menu.Menuitem].

members.name: setContext

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.description: Can be anything, will be returned at the menu-item-selected method

members.description: Sets the context. Use this if you want to set a Object as context

members.name: trigger
members.description: Triggers the context menu. Set by keyboard to true to focus the first element for keyboard navigation

members.name: _context
members.description: Use this to set a string value as context.

events.description: Fired when context menu was triggered
events.name: open-furo-data-menu-requested

events.description: Fired when a menu item is selected
events.name: menu-item-selected
